contentrichtext.text: '''James Assion Wright''' (August 11, 1902 – November 7, 1963) was an American lawyer from [[Pennsylvania]] who served in the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. Congress]] from 1941 to 1945. Wright was born in [[Carnegie, Pennsylvania|Carnegie]], [[Pennsylvania]]. He graduated from the [[College of the Holy Cross]] in [[Worcester, Massachusetts]] in 1923 and from the [[University of Pittsburgh School of Law]] in [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]], in 1927. He served as assistant county solicitor of [[Allegheny County, Pennsylvania]], from 1935 to 1941. Wright was elected as a Democrat to the [[77th United States Congress|Seventy-seventh]] and [[78th United States Congress|Seventy-eighth]] Congresses. He was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection in [[United States House election, 1944|1944]]. ==Sources== *{{CongBio|W000762}} *[http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/wright5.html The Political Graveyard] {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-hs}} {{USRepSuccessionBox | state=Pennsylvania | district=34 | before=[[Matthew A. Dunn]] | after=District Eliminated | years=1941–1943 }} {{USRepSuccessionBox | state=Pennsylvania | district=32 | before=[[Herman P. Eberharter]] | after=[[Herman P.
